messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/6/00 1:34:01 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Natrlmama@aol.com writes:  Same here,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/6/00 1:34:01 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Natrlmama@...
writes:

<< I just say we do year round, we never stop learning. >>

Same here, and I add that we do more inside learning in the summer and winter
and take advantage of the beautiful weather in the spring and fall. When it
starts hitting the mid-90's here in NC in the summer, people understand that
one!

Laura

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/02/2000 4:49:38 PM Pacific Daylight Time, gernert@iname.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/02/2000 4:49:38 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
gernert@... writes:

<< How do you and your kids respond to the question, "So when are
you done with school?" This is our first year of homeschooling and halfway
through
we switched to unschooling. So I guess we are always done with school, but
never
done with learning, but that just doesn't sound right. >>

I just say we do year round, we never stop learning. Were also apted to
vacation mid week, but don't tell anyone ; )

Kathy---life is a highway, I'm gonna drive it all night long LOL sorry that
song
is going through my head for some reason!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/00 10:10:06 PM Eastern Daylight Time, leschke@islandnet.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/00 10:10:06 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
leschke@... writes:

<< Another one that I get asked is, "Doesn't homeschooling take a lot of your
time?" >>

Reply: "And what a wonderful way to spend my time - discussing fascinating
subjects with the people I love most."

<g>,
Laura

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/2/00 7:49:37 PM Eastern Daylight Time, gernert@iname.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/2/00 7:49:37 PM Eastern Daylight Time, gernert@...
writes:

<< I have a question. How do you and your kids respond to the question, "So
when are
you done with school?" >>

We just say that we school year-round, and that we focus more on inside or
outside activities based on the season and the weather (lots of inside stuff
today since it hit 96 degrees!).

Where are you in NC?

Laura
(in Hillsborough)

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: My kids are very proud to tell people that we are never done school, because they learn all the time. Just explain it to them and let them explain it to
messages.messageBody:
My kids are very proud to tell people that we are never done school, because
they learn all the time. Just explain it to them and let them explain it to
others.
Amy
----- Original Message -----
From: The Gernerts <gernert@...>
To: <schools_out@egroups.com>; <unschooling@egroups.com>;
<Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>; <Fun-unschooling@egroups.com>;
<CCU-List@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 4:47 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???


> I have a question. How do you and your kids respond to the question, "So
when are
> you done with school?" This is our first year of homeschooling and
halfway through
> we switched to unschooling. So I guess we are always done with school,
but never
> done with learning, but that just doesn't sound right.
>
> What do you say?
>
> Tarla in NC
> Tarla
> Homeschooling two in N.C.
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] When are you out of school???
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/02/2000 11:49:37 PM !!!First Boot!!!, gernert@iname.com writes:  Well, things slow down over the summer.  But, of
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/02/2000 11:49:37 PM !!!First Boot!!!, gernert@...
writes:

<< What do you say? >>


"Well, things slow down over the summer. But, of course, we are sort of in
the habit now of going to the library once a week and there are all those
science experimetns we still want to get to. But, it is summer, so the beach
calls too."

I try not to rub it in too much that we actually went to the beach whenever
we wanted to during the year. :)

Nance
